page.title: 01AN AREA NEAR SEISDON
page.content: This block lies between the villages of Claverley and Seisdon. Its eastern boundary is some seven kilometres from Wolverhampton and its western boundary about nine kilometres from Bridgnorth. It includes some of Claverley's out- lying hamlets and part of the village of Seisdon, but otherwise there are no settlements of any size within it,only scattered houses or small groups of cottages. The county boundary runs through the block dividing it fairly equally but very irregularly into Shropshire on the west and Staffordshire on the east. It is a stretch of undramatic but very pleasant countryside, most of it intensively farmed and sparsely popu- lated.
